alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 8:48PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 846 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Huntley to 7 miles northeast of Pryor. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail, along with pockets of brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hardin, Fort Smith, Pryor, St. Xavier and Crow Indian Reservation. These storms will impact travel on I-90 between Billings and Hardin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone
